intro.description: We are going to load a shape file into our workspace using the New Layer dialog.

item.title: New Layer Wizard
item.description: Choose File > New > New Layer from the menu bar to open up the Add Data wizard

item.title: Select Files
item.description:
Select Files from the list of data sources and press Next to open up a file dialog.
A file dialog will open, then select a shape file from your data folder and press Open
Example: countries.shp

item.title: Load Data
item.description:
A new Map editor will be opened based on the contents of your shape file. The default name and projection of the Map has been taken from your shapefile.
You can see the Catalog view has been updated with an entry for the layer countries.shp. This view is used to track the use of resources by the uDig application.
The Layers view shows a single layer displayed on this map. This view is used to change the order and appearance of information in your Map.
The Projects view has been updated to show that your map is stored in projects. You can have multiple projects open at a time, each project can have several maps.
Tip You can also drag and drop shape files directly into the uDig application.
